title: Refraction - critical angle from Snells-law graph

content.question: In an experiment to determine the refractive index of a liquid, an engineer directs a laser beam from the air into the liquid. The engineer measures the angle of incidence <math alttext="theta sub air " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>air</mi></msub></math> in air and the angle of refraction <math alttext="theta sub liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>liq</mi></msub></math> in the liquid for various incident angles. The sines of the angles of incidence and refraction are then calculated and used to make the graph shown in the figure. According to the graph, at approximately what minimum angle of incidence in the liquid would a beam not be transmitted into the air?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
